required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 13, 2016
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Fluoxetine in Juvenile Fibromyalgia
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Clinical Trial of Fluoxetine Treatment of Juvenile Primary Fibromyalgia Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research is to conduct an open, pilot trial to assess the efficacy and safety of fluoxetine in the treatment of Juvenile Primary Fibromyalgia Syndrome (JPFS).

detailed_description.textblock: Fibromyalgia is a common condition that is often challenging to treat. It is defined by the American College of Rheumatology (ACR) as widespread pain of at least 3 months duration in combination with tenderness at 11 or more of 18 specific tender point sites on the body. The prevalence of JPFS in children and adolescents in the general population of the United States is unknown. Studies from Israel, Mexico, and Italy have estimated that the prevalence rate of JPFS in school children ranges from 1.24% to 6.20%, with girls making up the majority of cases. Information from a national registry in the United States indicates that JPFS accounts for about 7.7% of new patient diagnoses in a pediatric rheumatology setting. The mean age of onset of pediatric JPFS is 12 years. As in adults, JPFS has been diagnosed in children and adolescents using the ACR criteria. JPFS often leads to substantial morbidity and disability. For example, adolescents with JPFS reported significantly greater functional disability and greater number of school absences than those with other rheumatic diseases such as juvenile RA or lupus. The presence of high levels of pain and disability at this critical developmental stage place adolescents with JPFS at greater risk for long term social and occupational difficulties. Early diagnosis and effective intervention are therefore of critical importance.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome measure was average pain severity on the Pediatric Pain Questionnaire's 100-mm visual analog scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Clinical Global Impression of Severity Scale Evaluates the Severity of Illness at the Time of Assessment.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the time of the assessment

secondary_outcome.measure: The Patient Global Impression of Improvement Measures the Degree of Improvement Since Randomization at the Time of the Assessment.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: since randomization at the time of the assessment

secondary_outcome.measure: The Functional Disability Inventory-child Version Assesses Perceived Difficulty in Performing Activities in the Domains of School, Home, Recreation, and Social Interactions.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the time of the assessment

secondary_outcome.measure: The Functional Disability Inventory-parent Version Consists of the Same 15 Items as the Child Version But Allows the Parent to Provide Their Perception of the Child's Difficulty in Performing Activities in Physical and Psychosocial Domains.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the time of the assessment

secondary_outcome.measure: Children's Depression Inventory is a Self-reported Scale That is Widely Used in Studies of Children With Fibromyalgia.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the time of the assessment

secondary_outcome.measure: Multidimensional Anxiety Scale for Children is a Self-report Inventory That Assesses Four Areas of Anxiety Symptoms.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the time of the assessment

secondary_outcome.measure: Fibromyalgia Impact Questionnaire Modified for Children is a Self-report Instrument That Measures Function, Pain, Fatigue, Sleep Quality, Stiffness, Anxiety and Depression.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the time of the assessment

arm_group.description: All eligible patients were started on Fluoxetine at 10 mg once daily. The dose was flexibly dosed based on pain efficacy and tolerability to a final dose between 10 and 60 mg once daily.

intervention.description: Fluoxetine was started at 10 mg once daily. The dose was flexibly dosed based on pain efficacy and tolerability to a final dose between 10 and 60 mg once daily.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female or male outpatients 13 to 18 years of age.
- Fulfillment of the American College of Rheumatology (ACR) criteria for primary fibromyalgia.
- Ability to understand and cooperate with study procedures.
- Provision of parental written informed consent and verbal and written assent from the adolescent for participation in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unwillingness or inability on the part of the parent to provide written informed consent or for the adolescent to provide verbal and written assent.
- Lifetime history of psychosis, hypomania or mania.
- Diagnosis of alcohol or substance abuse or dependence within 6 months prior to screening visit.
- Patients judged to be at serious suicide or homicide risk.
- Girls who are pregnant or lactating. Girls of childbearing potential who are not using a medically accepted method of contraception (including barrier or hormonal methods).
- Clinically unstable medical or psychiatric conditions that could interfere with the absorption, metabolism, excretion, or safety of fluoxetine or interfere with the assessment of disease severity.
- Inability to exclude traumatic injury, regional or structural rheumatic disease, or infectious arthropathy as the etiology of their relevant fibromyalgia symptoms and that would interfere with interpretation of outcome measures (e.g., osteoarthritis, bursitis, tendonitis).
- History of an autoimmune disease or inflammatory arthritis, such as systemic lupus erythematosis (SLE) or rheumatoid arthritis (RA).
- Treatment with a monoamine oxidase inhibitor, tricyclic, SSRI antidepressant, or lithium within 2 weeks prior to beginning study medication.
- Treatment with analgesic medication (with the exception of acetaminophen and over-the-counter NSAIDs) within one week prior to beginning study medication.
- Treatment with any other excluded medication that cannot be discontinued at the screening visit.
- Previous treatment with fluoxetine.
- Treatment with any investigational medications within 30 days prior to screening.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Female or male patients from Children's Hospital pediatric outpatient rheumatology clinic were eligible for the trial if they were 13 to 17 years and met study criteria.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Patients who met entry criteria for juvenile fibromyalgia but did not meet any exclusion criteria.

group.title: Fluoxetine
group.description: All patients receiving Fluoxetine starting at 10 mg/day

group.title: Fluoxetine
group.description: All eligible patients were given fluoxetine

measure.title: Average Pain Severity
measure.description: The average pain severity on the Pediatric Pain Questionnaire’s 100-mm visual analog scale. This is a 100-mm horizontal line on which the patient’s pain intensity is represented by a point between the extremes of zero “no pain at all” and 100 “worst pain imaginable.”

outcome.title: The Clinical Global Impression of Severity Scale Evaluates the Severity of Illness at the Time of Assessment.
outcome.time_frame: at the time of the assessment

outcome.title: The Patient Global Impression of Improvement Measures the Degree of Improvement Since Randomization at the Time of the Assessment.
outcome.time_frame: since randomization at the time of the assessment

outcome.time_frame: at the time of the assessment

outcome.time_frame: at the time of the assessment

outcome.title: Children's Depression Inventory is a Self-reported Scale That is Widely Used in Studies of Children With Fibromyalgia.
outcome.time_frame: at the time of the assessment

outcome.title: Multidimensional Anxiety Scale for Children is a Self-report Inventory That Assesses Four Areas of Anxiety Symptoms.
outcome.time_frame: at the time of the assessment

outcome.title: Fibromyalgia Impact Questionnaire Modified for Children is a Self-report Instrument That Measures Function, Pain, Fatigue, Sleep Quality, Stiffness, Anxiety and Depression.

outcome.title: Average Pain Severity Score
outcome.description: The primary outcome measure was average pain severity on the Pediatric Pain Questionnaire’s 100-mm visual analog scale.
outcome.population: 6 participants out of 10 screened met entry criteria. Two were terminated due to SAEs.

group.title: Fluoxetine
group.description: Fluoxetine was started at 10 mg/day and adjusted based on pain efficacy and tolerability.

measure.title: Average Pain Severity Score
measure.description: The primary outcome measure was average pain severity on the Pediatric Pain Questionnaire’s 100-mm visual analog scale.

reported_events.desc: Period after screening when fluoxetine was started

group.description: Fluoxetine was started at 10 mg/day and adjusted based on pain efficacy and tolerability.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
